bibl.title: Possible Evidence for Ancient Egyptian Orthodontics.
bibl.note: Report on a dental investigation by Melbourne University's Forensic Odontology Unit of a Graeco-Roman mummified child's head (kept at the Australian Institute of Archaeology) with an unusual absence of teeth, suggesting possible orthodontic practices.
CRAIG Pamela and Janet DAVEY, Possible Evidence for Ancient Egyptian Orthodontics.
Egyptian Archaeology 18 (2001) pp. 37-39, 5 figg. coul., 6 figg. n./bl.
